fields.description:
First I created a GIT repository (rounduplm) to hold the contents.

Then I tried to use the importer to retrieve files from a remote SVN repository which required authentication. As part of the authentication I entered my username/password. When I hit ENTER the error I got back was 'authentication error'. I did it 3 times to make sure I typed it in right and caps lock was off. Same error. I happened to scroll down and noticed that it was complaining that the GIT repository already exists. I deleted the rounduplm GIT repository and used the importer successfully this time.

The importer improperly reported 'authentication error' when it should have reported something like 'repository already exists' at the top of the page.
fields.summary: Importer reports wrong error (BB-8807)

fields.description:
I understand that you refuse to limit the auto-complete to current team members in private repositories. What you should understand from the other issues I've seen on this is that the current auto-complete is practically useless.

# I am always much more likely to @ mention someone on the current team than someone off the team (for public repos, I'd assume I'm much more likely to mention someone who has already contributed, submitted a pull request, etc)
# I do not remember the usernames some of my team members have created (which are unrelated to their legal names)
# Given the vast number of user accounts, I can type my team members' full names and still not see my team members in the auto-complete list

Even if I only type "@a" - the top result should be one of my team members that has an "a" in their name or username - any partial match in my team always takes precedence over other users.
fields.summary: @ mention auto-complete should always show any of my matching team members first (BB-8826)

Currently, this macro is not interpreted; it just shows up in "display" mode as the literal {{<<toc>>}} character sequence.

All of the pages in our wiki are in Markdown syntax.

On-site text editor commits don't appear in recent activity list

fields.description:
When using the close after merge option for pull requests in hg you first do the merge and close the branch after that. This leaves the closing changeset as an unmerged head.\\
This not only looks messy but also leads to a "creates new remote head" problem if you later create a branch with the same name. You then have to merge the closing changeset or force push the other head.\\
If you would change to first closing the branch and then merging the closing changeset this problem would go away and the tree would also look much better.
fields.summary: Change close after merge to close before merge for Mercurial

fields.description:

Started for me here in southern Missouri USA about 2 weeks ago. I had a road trip for 10 days and tonight same thing. I've tried two different computers and different ip addresses. No joy.j

Symptoms are unstyled content. (have to fish around to find things.)

-TJ

fields.description:
I have this issue (errno 10054 connection breaks when pushing on win 7 64 tortoise hg) https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3578/cannot-push-fatal-the-remote-end-hung-up\\
so I switched to ssl using this guide https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Set+up+SSH+for+Mercurial\\
but now pushing takes extremely long. I currently have 900mb commit consisting of 13 files and currently it bundles them (current state is : bundling 11/13) and it's been more than two hours. So I haven't uploaded anything in two hours. While on HTTPS it took less than a minute

Windows 7 x64, tortoise hg 2.8.1
fields.summary: mercurial slow "pushes" after switching to ssl (BB-8789)

fields.description:
I wanted to import issues from my Trac project. In the end, I wrote a python script to build what I thought was a compliant db-1.0.json file.  But I am stymied by the error message mentioned in the title.

(and yes, I did read https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=330796872 closely)

I tried to reduce the import to the minimal set required to reproduce the problem.  In the end it is very minimal indeed!

{code}
#!json

{ "components" : [ "website" ],
  "issues" : [ { "assignee" : "unayok",
        "component" : "website",
        "content" : "Content.",
        "content_updated_on" : "2009-01-18T09:55:21.000000+00:00",
        "created_on" : "2009-01-18T09:55:01.000000+00:00",
        "edited_on" : "2009-01-18T09:55:21.000000+00:00",
        "id" : 1,
        "kind" : "task",
        "milestone" : "creation",
        "priority" : "critical",
        "reporter" : "unayok",
        "status" : "resolved",
        "title" : "Title",
        "updated_on" : "2009-01-18T09:55:21.000000+00:00"
      }
    ],
  "meta" : { "default_assignee" : "unayok",
      "default_component" : "website",
      "default_kind" : "bug"
    },
  "milestones" : [ "creation" ],
  "versions" : [ "1.0" ]
}
{code}

The much more complete export also failed (with a complement of "comments", "log" but no "attachments").  I expect either there's a bug that needs fixing or the documentation on imports needs to be clearer as to the requirements.  The only idea that comes to mind is that the 'id' is not unique from BitBucket's overall perspective.  This isn't discussed either way in the document.

I don't mind meeting tough guidelines for creating an import file as long as they're documented. I think there's an actual bug here though.  Better error messages would be useful too. :)
fields.summary: Issue Import: TypeError: string indices must be integers

fields.description:
It would be very useful to be able to post a short introduction to yourself, your interests, etc on your project listing page.  In particular this would allow posting something like a simple CV, or summary of your experience that may be hard to ascertain from just looking at your listed projects and contributions.

As for where to read the markdown from, I would suggest using the already-reserved <username>.bitbucket.org repository.  As README.md already is used on the project page for that, I would suggest using USER.md within the top level of that repository.
fields.summary: Allow user page markdown summary (BB-8759)

Since I want to access its raw Markdown (to copy), I hit button=Raw ... which shows me [more rendered HTML|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii_ag_soil/raw/d54aece7445a248bd6485d642a163e2f67470134/README.md], just like the previous page, though without the bitbucket UI "wrapping."

Should't clicking a button marked "Raw" show me the raw Markdown for the file?

fields.description: I have a development branch and a master branch. Is there a way in bitbucket to merge master to my development branch when there is a development branch push. Push should fail if the merge fails. Is there any way to get this done ?
fields.summary: Auto merge master on push of dev branch (BB-8751)

fields.description:
Hey,

When my manager approves for changes made by developer, my web admin merge the changes to the master, but once the changes are merged. Manager can still see and click on unapprove button. Which is not a correct flow IMO. What if manager unapprove after a change is merged, when that change is not correct/ buggy, that eventually removes the approval messages from activity tab, too. Web admin's job is just to merge the changes(i.e. he is not aware of code much, manager does). Once it's approved web admin blindly merges the change. Any idea?
fields.summary: Unapprove button shouldn't come once the changes are merged (BB-8739)

fields.description:
Our feature branch names tend to get quite long once in a while.

We have quite a large project and we sometimes use namespaces, for example: feature/namespace/branchname.

When "namespace" gets long, all the branch names look the same. It is frustrating because we may have several different pull requests from different branches, but the branch name cannot be seen in the BitBucket UI (since it will be truncated and all branchnames have the same namespace). See the attached images.

Please add some space to the branch name view, thank you!  :)
fields.summary: Not enough space for branch name in pull request view (BB-8740)

fields.description:
Hi,

We've been intermittently experiencing extremely slow git clone speeds for our BitBucket repository 'mbst/infra' in our AWS Infrastructure in Region eu-west. This has been exhibited on multiple Availability Zones, and on different instance types. While normally clone speeds are >1MB/s, we see sustained periods of time where the clone speed is ~25-50KB/s. I've tested with other services like GitHub and the clone speeds there are unaffected.

I have included a tracepath for an instance which is actively experiencing issues retrieving a repo from bitbucket.org:

{code}
#!bash
traceroute bitbucket.org
traceroute to bitbucket.org (207.223.240.182), 30 hops max, 60 byte packets

 8  213.242.106.85 (213.242.106.85)  1.686 ms 178.236.0.121 (178.236.0.121)  1.532 ms 213.242.106.85 (213.242.106.85)  1.636 ms
 9  213.242.106.85 (213.242.106.85)  1.619 ms ae-1-4.bar1.Dublin3.Level3.net (4.69.153.238)  2.321 ms ae-12-12.ebr2.Paris1.Level3.net (4.69.153.242)  118.822 ms
10  ae-12-12.ebr2.Paris1.Level3.net (4.69.153.242)  118.799 ms ae-1-4.bar1.Dublin3.Level3.net (4.69.153.238)  2.238 ms ae-42-42.ebr2.Washington1.Level3.net (4.69.137.54)  117.943 ms
11  ae-12-12.ebr2.Paris1.Level3.net (4.69.153.242)  118.726 ms  118.886 ms ae-5-5.ebr2.Washington12.Level3.net (4.69.143.222)  117.384 ms
12  ae-5-5.ebr2.Washington12.Level3.net (4.69.143.222)  117.372 ms  117.537 ms ae-6-6.ebr2.Chicago2.Level3.net (4.69.148.146)  117.145 ms

14  ae-1-100.ebr1.Chicago2.Level3.net (4.69.132.113)  117.702 ms  117.191 ms ae-6-6.ebr2.Chicago2.Level3.net (4.69.148.146)  118.831 ms

When I clone the repository from our London based office, we see much more acceptable speeds. The traceroute is as follows:

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-selenium

This repository initially was as big as the page says (96 MB), but then we pruned the big blobs from history and got it down to 2-3 MB. The page still shows 96, though. One reason may be that those files did not get pruned on BB side. FWIW a fresh clone is definitely only 2-3 MB.
fields.summary: Repo size seems to not get updated

fields.description:
We use bitbucket teams to manage the various codebases of our company. Our aim is to have all repositories with the team account as owner, since that is a lot more maintainable than scattered personal repositories.

When creating new repositories it is quite easy, especially for users inexperienced with bitbucket, to miss changing the owner from the own account (default) to the team account.

We could make sure to educate everyone, and make sure to hunt down and assimilate any personal repo being created (they can be difficult to notice), but that seems like tedious work that could be avoided.

It would be better if the default was more in line with how we work. We also assume that we are not the only ones using bitbucket mainly for the team feature, so this feature should benefit most users of team accounts.

Our suggestion is one of the following:

a) Default to Team account under the right conditions

# When using the create repository dialog, the owner chosen should be the default owner the next time the dialog is used.
# If user belongs to a team, has no personal repositories and has not commited to any repositories outside the team, default to the team account.

b) Allow the default owner to be configurable, configuration should default to the team account if the user signed up from a team invite email and to the own account otherwise.

Option a) is preferable in our opinion
fields.summary: Allow team owner default on repository create dialog (BB-8734)

fields.description:
On [this pull request|https://bitbucket.org/metabrainz/musicbrainz-server/pull-request/230/mbs-6395-call-durationlookup-update-on/diff] the "Files Changed" section lists 2850 changed files.  It seems to think most or all files in the repository are being deleted by the pull request.

A git diff master...HEAD on the branch shows only six files changed.
fields.summary: Pull Request "Files Changed" list is incorrectly lists thousands of unchanged files. (BB-8729)

fields.description:
Please compare the display of a commit message containing whitespace:

* https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial/commits/bf9a105aed0a
* http://selenic.com/hg/rev/bf9a105aed0a

On Bitbucket, leading whitespace (any whitespace really) is lost and this makes it hard to understand code/tracebacks/etc that are copy-pasted into the commit messages — thus ruining the careful formatting applied by the commiter.

Adding a {{whitespace: pre}} CSS rule would fix this on Bitbucket.

I would also appreciate an option to change the font to monospace, but that is something slightly different from the main issue here.
fields.summary: Preserve whitespace in commit messages (BB-8728)

Pascal

fields.description:
Is it possible for you to instruct users not to post only {{+1}} comments to issues and encourage them to {{watch}} the issues instead? Many good comments just gets buried under the +1 spam. Not to mention the Notification spam those comments causes...

One possible place for it could be the placeholder text {{What do you want to say?}} in write a new comment textfield.

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/techtonik/hexdump

On this page the width of each line with hex dump is 79 symbols. Firefox on Ubuntu shows a meaningless horizontal scrollbar on it. It will be awesome if 80-symbols wide code sections didn't require scrollbars.

fields.description: Each user page (e.g., [mine|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche]) has four tabs, one of which is marked ['Following'|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/profile/following]. It Would Be Convenient to list here the issues which the user is watching. (Alternatively, you could add a separate tab=Watching but that seems like clutter--YMMV.)

fields.description:
Many of us here code in Python and many also use [Sphinx|http://sphinx-doc.org/] as our documentation builder.

This means we need to use [restructuredText|http://docutils.sourceforge.net/rst.html] for documents, not Markdown to maintain our sanity.  But, it also means giving up syntax highlighting at Bitbucket.  :(

BB [supports this already|http://blog.bitbucket.org/2012/02/16/syntax-highlighting-for-markdown-readmes/] for Markdown, how about for RST?
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for restructuredText READMEs (BB-8724)
test

As a code reviewer I would like to have a static/floating comment box while scroll through a pull request (similar to [Gmail's "new" compose feature|http://gmailblog.blogspot.com/2012/10/introducing-new-compose-in-gmail.html]) so that I can easily write an overarching comment while reviewing.

_I do use line comments_
fields.summary: Static comment composition on pull request for code review (BB-8719)

fields.description:
BitBucket does not display commit messages in UTF-8 correctly. It interprets them as Latin-1, which generates garbage. Consequently, the affected commit messages are unreadable.

Since it is very simple to determine whether a string is valid UTF-8, BitBucket can easily use UTF-8 for UTF-8 messages, and only fall back to something obsolete like Latin-1 if the message is not valid UTF-8.

Note that such a change has no effect on commit messages in pure ASCII, which is probably the vast majority.
fields.summary: Commit messages in UTF-8 are garbled (BB-8715)

fields.description:
It will be nice to have a special label 'TeX' on the default icon for TeX repositories to ident them quickly. Like this is done for many other languages (C/C++/C#).\\

fields.description:
One of my team's repositories just started presenting a weird issue where the users list in the Config > Access Management section suddenly dissapears and is replaced by a single line "(Resend invitation)".

This started happening right after adding a user by its email address. Some members of the team *can't access the repository* now.

I've discovered that clicking anywhere (navigation-wise, including the very same Access Management section link, also by pressing F5) triggers the error (see screenshot "2 - After").

I can see the correct list again (see screenshot "1 - Before") by logging out and in, or by pressing CTRL+F5.

Maybe some data got corrupted and is now inconsistent?
fields.summary: Access Management users dissapearing, cannot access (BB-8726)

fields.description:
In my opinion any private repository that has been forked should inherit the administrators forcefully so that administrators can always manage the visibility of any private forks. This would be similar to the "can't ever become public" attribute that they have.

I really hate this at my company, and I know another company that wants to switch their development team to bb, but won't because of this restriction.
fields.summary: Option to force forks to inherit permissions (BB-8723)

I am trying to setup a Jenkins job as a post-commit Service for my Bitbucket repo. Trying to use the standard Jenkins service, that was never executing. I finally gave up and tried a standard post service with the following URL (pw obscured):\\
https://lsi%40liquidation.com:8154314@lsi.ci.cloudbees.com/job/GitRef2Dev/build?token=tkn

When running "curl -O {same URL}" from command line, my Jenkins job kicks off right away, but no pushes to master on that repo in Bitbucket show any reaction to Jenkins. What could be the difference here? Jenkins URL is accessible from URL as it's running in the cloud.

fields.description:
I have a [wiki page|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/aqmeii-na_n2o/wiki/N2O_emission_inventories_over_AQMEII-NA_2008] which includes some preformatted/nowiki text (copied from another webpage): {code} {{{ Agricultural waste burning (4F) Energy manufacturing transformation (1A1+1A2) Industrial process and product use (2) Manure management (4B) Oil production and refineries (1B2) Residential (1A4) Road transportation (1A3b) Agricultural soils (4C+4D) Non-road transportation (1A3a+c+d+e) Fossil Fuel Fires (7A) Large Scale Biomass Burning (5A+C+D+F+4E) => Totals Indirect emissions from NOx and NH3 (7B+7C) Indirect N2O emissions from agriculture (4D3) Waste solid and wastewater (6) }}} {code} Your parser renders this appropriately in the body of the page: {code} #!HTML 
Agricultural waste burning (4F)
Energy manufacturing transformation (1A1+1A2)
Industrial process and product use (2)
Manure management (4B)
Oil production and refineries (1B2)
Residential (1A4)
Road transportation (1A3b)
Agricultural soils (4C+4D)
Non-road transportation (1A3a+c+d+e)
Fossil Fuel Fires (7A)
Large Scale Biomass Burning (5A+C+D+F+4E)
=> Totals
Indirect emissions from NOx and NH3 (7B+7C)
Indirect N2O emissions from agriculture (4D3)
Waste solid and wastewater (6)
{code} However, and IMHO inappropriately, part of the nowiki text is identified as a heading and included in the file's TOC: {code} #!HTML
  • N2O sources and sinks
    • EPA N2O estimates
  • currently available N2O inventories
    • IPCC codes
    • timesteps
    • gridcells
    • units
    • CLM-CN-3.5 DNDC-based process model
    • EDGAR-4.2
  • > Totals
    • EPIC-0509
    • GEIA
    • GFED-3.1
  • my N2O inventory choices
    • N2O inventory assimilation
    • AQMEII_ag_soil
    • CLM_CN_global_to_AQMEII-NA
    • EDGAR-4.2_minus_soil_and_biomass_to_AQMEII-NA
    • GEIA_regrid
    • GFED-3.1_global_to_AQMEII-NA
{code} Please fix.
fields.summary: [creole] nowiki text parsed as heading, creates TOC link (BB-8716)
